articles.title: Spanish Making Up & Reconciliation Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
After every disagreement comes the crucial moment of making up. When you're with a Spanish speaker, knowing how to reconcile in their language can deepen your connection and heal wounds faster. Here are essential Spanish phrases for those important moments of reconciliation.

## Apologizing Sincerely

### Lo siento mucho
**Pronunciation:** loh SYEHN-toh MOO-choh

**Meaning:** "I'm very sorry"

**When to use it:** The most common and heartfelt apology. Adding "mucho" (very) emphasizes your sincerity.

### PerdÃ³name
**Pronunciation:** pehr-DOH-nah-meh

**Meaning:** "Forgive me"

**When to use it:** A direct request for forgiveness, more emotionally vulnerable than "lo siento."

### Me equivoquÃ©
**Pronunciation:** meh eh-kee-voh-KEH

**Meaning:** "I was wrong"

**When to use it:** When acknowledging your mistake clearly. Taking responsibility matters.

### No deberÃ­a haber dicho eso
**Pronunciation:** noh deh-beh-REE-ah ah-BEHR DEE-choh EH-soh

**Meaning:** "I shouldn't have said that"

**When to use it:** When you regret specific words spoken during the argument.

## Expressing Your Feelings

### Odio cuando peleamos
**Pronunciation:** OH-dyoh KWAHN-doh peh-leh-AH-mohs

**Meaning:** "I hate when we fight"

**When to use it:** To express how much conflict bothers you and your desire for peace.

### Te extraÃ±o cuando estamos asÃ­
**Pronunciation:** teh ehks-TRAH-nyoh KWAHN-doh ehs-TAH-mohs ah-SEE

**Meaning:** "I miss you when we're like this"

**When to use it:** To express longing for closeness even when you're still together.

### Me duele estar enojados
**Pronunciation:** meh DWEH-leh ehs-TAHR eh-noh-HAH-dohs

**Meaning:** "It hurts me that we're angry"

**When to use it:** To share the emotional pain of being at odds.

## Reaching Out

### Â¿Podemos hablar?
**Pronunciation:** poh-DEH-mohs ah-BLAHR

**Meaning:** "Can we talk?"

**When to use it:** The first step in breaking the ice after a disagreement.

### Quiero arreglar las cosas
**Pronunciation:** KYEH-roh ah-rreh-GLAHR lahs KOH-sahs

**Meaning:** "I want to fix things"

**When to use it:** To show your commitment to resolution.

### Â¿Podemos empezar de nuevo?
**Pronunciation:** poh-DEH-mohs ehm-peh-SAHR deh NWEH-voh

**Meaning:** "Can we start over?"

**When to use it:** When you want to reset and move forward together.

## Expressing Love and Commitment

### Te amo, eso no cambia
**Pronunciation:** teh AH-moh, EH-soh noh KAHM-byah

**Meaning:** "I love you, that doesn't change"

**When to use it:** To reassure your partner that your love endures despite conflict.

### Eres mÃ¡s importante que esta pelea
**Pronunciation:** EH-rehs mahs eem-pohr-TAHN-teh keh EHS-tah peh-LEH-ah

**Meaning:** "You're more important than this fight"

**When to use it:** To put the relationship above the disagreement.

### No quiero perderte
**Pronunciation:** noh KYEH-roh pehr-DEHR-teh

**Meaning:** "I don't want to lose you"

**When to use it:** When expressing how much the relationship means to you.

### Luchemos juntos, no el uno contra el otro
**Pronunciation:** loo-CHEH-mohs HOON-tohs, noh ehl OO-noh KOHN-trah ehl OH-troh

**Meaning:** "Let's fight together, not against each other"

**When to use it:** To reframe the situation as partners versus the problem.

## Moving Forward

### Â¿CÃ³mo podemos evitar esto en el futuro?
**Pronunciation:** KOH-moh poh-DEH-mohs eh-vee-TAHR EHS-toh ehn ehl foo-TOO-roh

**Meaning:** "How can we avoid this in the future?"

**When to use it:** To focus on preventing similar conflicts.

### Prometo intentar hacerlo mejor
**Pronunciation:** proh-MEH-toh een-tehn-TAHR ah-SEHR-loh meh-HOHR

**Meaning:** "I promise to try to do better"

**When to use it:** To commit to improvement.

## Cultural Notes on Reconciliation

In Spanish-speaking cultures, making up is often an emotional, expressive process. Physical affectionâ€”hugs, kisses, holding handsâ€”frequently accompanies verbal reconciliation. Don't hold back on warmth.

Spanish speakers may value thorough reconciliation over quickly "moving on." Taking time to express feelings fully and reconnect emotionally is important.

Sharing a meal together or doing something enjoyable can be part of the healing process. "Hacer las paces" (making peace) is a meaningful concept.

## The Sweetest Words

Remember that after an argument, simple expressions of love carry extra weight. "Te quiero" (I love you/I care for you) and "Te amo" (I love you, deeply) remind your partner what truly matters. Making up in Spanish isn't just about wordsâ€”it's about restoring the warmth and connection that define your relationship.

articles.title: Vocabulaire anglais pour voyager en couple
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Voyager en couple dans un pays anglophone est une aventure merveilleuse ! Mais pour en profiter pleinement, il faut maÃ®triser le vocabulaire essentiel. De l'aÃ©roport Ã  l'hÃ´tel, voici tout ce dont vous avez besoin.

## Ã€ l'aÃ©roport

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Where is the check-in counter?"
  translation="OÃ¹ est le comptoir d'enregistrement ?"
  pronunciation="ouÃ¨r iz the TCHÃˆK-in KAOUN-teur"
  context="PremiÃ¨re question en arrivant Ã  l'aÃ©roport"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Boarding pass"
  translation="Carte d'embarquement"
  pronunciation="BOR-ding pass"
  example="Please have your boarding pass ready."
/>

### Vocabulaire de l'aÃ©roport

| Anglais | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|---------|---------------|----------|
| Check-in | TCHÃˆK-in | Enregistrement |
| Security check | si-KIOU-ri-ti tchÃ¨k | ContrÃ´le de sÃ©curitÃ© |
| Boarding gate | BOR-ding guÃ©Ã¯t | Porte d'embarquement |
| Departure lounge | di-PAR-tcheur launj | Salle d'embarquement |
| Arrivals | euh-RAÃV-eulz | ArrivÃ©es |
| Departures | di-PAR-tcheurz | DÃ©parts |
| Baggage claim | BA-guidj klÃ©Ã¯m | RÃ©cupÃ©ration des bagages |
| Customs | KEUS-teumz | Douane |

<VocabCard
  word="Is this flight on time?"
  translation="Ce vol est-il Ã  l'heure ?"
  pronunciation="iz this flaÃ¯t on taÃ¯m"
  example="Excuse me, is this flight on time?"
/>

### Phrases utiles Ã  l'aÃ©roport

| Situation | Anglais | FranÃ§ais |
|-----------|---------|----------|
| Enregistrement | We'd like seats together | Nous voudrions des siÃ¨ges cÃ´te Ã  cÃ´te |
| Bagages | Is this bag too heavy? | Ce sac est-il trop lourd ? |
| Retard | When is the next flight? | Quand est le prochain vol ? |
| Perte | We've lost our luggage | Nous avons perdu nos bagages |

<CultureTip title="Les liquides en cabine" flag="ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§">
N'oubliez pas la rÃ¨gle des liquides : maximum 100ml par contenant, tous dans un sac plastique transparent de 1 litre maximum. En anglais : Â« liquids in containers of 100ml or less in a clear plastic bag Â».
</CultureTip>

## Dans l'avion

<VocabCard
  word="Could I have a blanket, please?"
  translation="Pourrais-je avoir une couverture, s'il vous plaÃ®t ?"
  pronunciation="koud aÃ¯ hav euh BLAN-kit pliz"
  example="It's cold. Could I have a blanket, please?"
/>

### Vocabulaire Ã  bord

| Anglais | FranÃ§ais |
|---------|----------|
| Window seat | SiÃ¨ge cÃ´tÃ© hublot |
| Aisle seat | SiÃ¨ge cÃ´tÃ© couloir |
| Overhead compartment | Compartiment Ã  bagages |
| Seatbelt | Ceinture de sÃ©curitÃ© |
| Tray table | Tablette |
| Flight attendant | Agent de bord |
| Turbulence | Turbulences |

<VocabCard
  word="Could we switch seats?"
  translation="Pourrions-nous Ã©changer nos places ?"
  pronunciation="koud oui souitchseats"
  example="Excuse me, we're a couple. Could we switch seats?"
/>

## Ã€ l'hÃ´tel

<PhraseOfDay
  word="We have a reservation under the name..."
  translation="Nous avons une rÃ©servation au nom de..."
  pronunciation="oui hav euh rÃ¨-zeur-VÃ‰Ã-cheun EUN-deur the nÃ©Ã¯m"
  context="Phrase d'arrivÃ©e Ã  l'hÃ´tel"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Could we have a room with a view?"
  translation="Pourrions-nous avoir une chambre avec vue ?"
  pronunciation="koud oui hav euh roum ouith euh viou"
  example="It's our anniversary. Could we have a room with a view?"
/>

### Types de chambres

| Anglais | FranÃ§ais | Description |
|---------|----------|-------------|
| Single room | Chambre simple | 1 lit simple |
| Double room | Chambre double | 1 grand lit |
| Twin room | Chambre Ã  deux lits | 2 lits simples |
| Suite | Suite | Chambre de luxe |
| Sea view | Vue sur mer | Face Ã  la mer |
| City view | Vue sur ville | Face Ã  la ville |

### Demandes Ã  l'hÃ´tel

| Anglais | FranÃ§ais |
|---------|----------|
| What time is check-out? | Ã€ quelle heure est le dÃ©part ? |
| Is breakfast included? | Le petit-dÃ©jeuner est-il inclus ? |
| Could we have extra towels? | Pourrions-nous avoir des serviettes supplÃ©mentaires ? |
| Is there a safe in the room? | Y a-t-il un coffre-fort dans la chambre ? |
| Where is the elevator? | OÃ¹ est l'ascenseur ? |
| Can we leave our luggage? | Pouvons-nous laisser nos bagages ? |

<VocabCard
  word="We'd like to extend our stay"
  translation="Nous aimerions prolonger notre sÃ©jour"
  pronunciation="ouid laÃ¯k tou iks-TÃˆND aour stÃ©Ã¯"
  example="We're having such a great time. We'd like to extend our stay."
/>

<CultureTip title="Le pourboire Ã  l'hÃ´tel" flag="ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸">
Aux Ã‰tats-Unis, il est courant de laisser 1-2 dollars par nuit pour le personnel de mÃ©nage (housekeeping). Laissez-les sur l'oreiller avec un petit mot Â« Thank you! Â». Pour le porteur de bagages : 1-2 dollars par sac.
</CultureTip>

## Les transports

<VocabCard
  word="How do I get to...?"
  translation="Comment aller Ã ... ?"
  pronunciation="haou dou aÃ¯ guÃ¨t tou"
  example="Excuse me, how do I get to the city center?"
/>

### Moyens de transport

| Anglais | Prononciation | FranÃ§ais |
|---------|---------------|----------|
| Subway/Underground | SEUB-ouÃ©Ã¯ / EUN-deur-graound | MÃ©tro |
| Bus | beus | Bus |
| Taxi/Cab | TAK-si / kab | Taxi |
| Tram | tram | Tramway |
| Ferry | FÃˆ-ri | Ferry |
| Rental car | RÃˆN-teul kar | Voiture de location |

### Phrases pour les transports

| Situation | Anglais |
|-----------|---------|
| Acheter un billet | Two tickets to downtown, please |
| Demander son chemin | Which platform for the train to...? |
| Taxi | Could you take us to this address? |
| Location | We'd like to rent a car for 3 days |

<VocabCard
  word="Keep the change"
  translation="Gardez la monnaie"
  pronunciation="kip the tchÃ©Ã¯ndj"
  example="Here you go. Keep the change!"
/>

## Demander son chemin

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Excuse me, could you help us?"
  translation="Excusez-moi, pourriez-vous nous aider ?"
  pronunciation="iks-KIOUZ mi, koud you hÃ¨lp eus"
  context="FaÃ§on polie de demander de l'aide"
/>

### Directions essentielles

| Anglais | FranÃ§ais |
|---------|----------|
| Turn left/right | Tournez Ã  gauche/droite |
| Go straight | Allez tout droit |
| It's on your left/right | C'est sur votre gauche/droite |
| Cross the street | Traversez la rue |
| It's next to... | C'est Ã  cÃ´tÃ© de... |
| It's opposite... | C'est en face de... |

<VocabCard
  word="Is it within walking distance?"
  translation="Peut-on y aller Ã  pied ?"
  pronunciation="iz it ouith-IN WO-king DIS-teuns"
  example="Is the museum within walking distance from here?"
/>

## Exercices pour couples

### Simulation aÃ©roport
Jouez les scÃ¨nes d'enregistrement, de contrÃ´le de sÃ©curitÃ© et d'embarquement ensemble.

### RÃ©servation fictive
Appelez un hÃ´tel (ou faites semblant) et rÃ©servez une chambre en anglais.

### Jeu des directions
L'un cache un objet, l'autre doit le trouver en suivant les directions donnÃ©es en anglais.

<CultureTip title="Google Maps en anglais" flag="ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸">
Mettez votre tÃ©lÃ©phone en anglais pendant vos voyages. Les instructions GPS en anglais seront une excellente pratique : Â« Turn right in 200 meters Â», Â« Your destination is on the left Â».
</CultureTip>

Avec ce vocabulaire, vous Ãªtes prÃªts Ã  explorer le monde anglophone main dans la main. Bon voyage !

<CTA text="PrÃªts pour l'aventure en anglais ?" buttonText="Commencer maintenant" />

articles.title: GramÃ¡tica Sueca para Principiantes: Aprende Juntos con Tu Pareja
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Â¿Te imaginas construyendo frases romÃ¡nticas en sueco con tu pareja? La gramÃ¡tica sueca es mÃ¡s simple de lo que piensas, y aprenderla juntos los acercarÃ¡ aÃºn mÃ¡s. Al final de este artÃ­culo, podrÃ¡n crear sus propias frases de amor y mantener conversaciones bÃ¡sicas con naturalidad.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jag Ã¤lskar dig"
  translation="Te amo"
  pronunciation="yahg ELS-kahr day"
  context="La frase mÃ¡s importante que aprenderÃ¡s juntos. Ãšsala con tu pareja todos los dÃ­as."
/>

## La ExplicaciÃ³n Simple: Â¿QuÃ© Hace Especial al Sueco?

El sueco comparte muchas similitudes con el inglÃ©s, pero con una estructura mÃ¡s lÃ³gica. Piensa en ello como construir con bloques LEGO: cada pieza tiene su lugar, y cuando aprendes las reglas bÃ¡sicas, puedes crear frases hermosas juntos.

A diferencia del espaÃ±ol, el sueco no tiene conjugaciones complicadas de verbos segÃºn la persona. Â¡Es decir, el verbo se mantiene igual para yo, tÃº, Ã©l, nosotros! Esto hace que [aprender sueco con tu pareja](/learn/es/sv/is-swedish-hard-to-learn/) sea mucho mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil que otros idiomas.

## Las Reglas BÃ¡sicas (Que Necesitas Saber)

### 1. Orden de Palabras: Sujeto + Verbo + Objeto
Igual que en espaÃ±ol, pero mÃ¡s flexible:
- **Jag Ã¤lskar dig** (Yo te amo) - "yahg ELS-kahr day"
- **Du Ã¤lskar mig** (TÃº me amas) - "doo ELS-kahr may"

### 2. No Hay ArtÃ­culos Indeterminados
En sueco, "en/ett" significa tanto "un/una" como simplemente sustantivo:
- **en kÃ¤rlek** (un amor) - "ehn SHAHR-lehk"
- **ett hjÃ¤rta** (un corazÃ³n) - "eht YAR-tah"

### 3. Los Verbos No Cambian SegÃºn la Persona
<VocabCard
  word="att Ã¤lska"
  translation="amar"
  pronunciation="aht ELS-kah"
  example="Jag Ã¤lskar, du Ã¤lskar, vi Ã¤lskar - todos usan la misma forma."
/>

### 4. Preguntas: Invierte el Orden
Para hacer preguntas, simplemente pon el verbo antes del sujeto:
- **Ã„lskar du mig?** (Â¿Me amas?) - "ELS-kahr doo may?"
- **Vill du ha en kram?** (Â¿Quieres un abrazo?) - "vill doo hah ehn krahmm?"

## Ejemplos para Parejas: Vocabulario RomÃ¡ntico

| Sueco | TraducciÃ³n | PronunciaciÃ³n | Nota Gramatical |
|--------|------------|---------------|-----------------|
| **Du Ã¤r vacker** | Eres hermosa/o | "doo ahr VAH-keh" | Adjetivo despuÃ©s del verbo "Ã¤r" |
| **Jag saknar dig** | Te extraÃ±o | "yahg SAHK-nahr day" | Verbo regular |
| **Du gÃ¶r mig lycklig** | Me haces feliz | "doo yur may LUCK-lee" | Verbo + objeto + adjetivo |
| **Vi passar ihop** | Hacemos buena pareja | "vee pahs-sahr EE-hoop" | Verbo reflexivo |
| **Min Ã¤lskling** | Mi amor | "meen ELS-kleeng" | Sustantivo posesivo |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª" title="Tutear en Suecia">
En Suecia, todo el mundo se tutea. Incluso con desconocidos usan "du". Esto hace que expresar amor sea mÃ¡s Ã­ntimo y directo. Â¡Perfecto para parejas!
</CultureTip>

## Patrones Comunes Que UsarÃ¡s Diariamente

### Presente de Verbos Regulares
AÃ±ade **-r** al infinitivo:
- **att krama** â†’ **jag kramar** (abrazar â†’ yo abrazo)
- **att kyssa** â†’ **jag kysser** (besar â†’ yo beso)

### Posesivos: MÃ¡s Simples Que en EspaÃ±ol
<ConjugationTable
  verb="Min/Mitt"
  meaning="Mi/Mis"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo (comÃºn)", polish: "min", english: "mi (para en/ett)" },
    { person: "Yo (neutro)", polish: "mitt", english: "mi (solo ett)" },
    { person: "Plural", polish: "mina", english: "mis" },
    { person: "TÃº (comÃºn)", polish: "din", english: "tu/tus" },
    { person: "TÃº (neutro)", polish: "ditt", english: "tu/tus" },
    { person: "Nosotros", polish: "vÃ¥r", english: "nuestro/a" }
  ]}
/>

### Frases Para Practicar Juntos

1. **Vill du fÃ¶lja med mig pÃ¥ bio?** (Â¿Quieres venir al cine conmigo?) - "vill doh FUL-yah meh may poo BEE-oh"
2. **Du luktar gott** (Hueles bien) - "doo LUK-tahr goht"
3. **Jag tÃ¤nker pÃ¥ dig hela tiden** (Pienso en ti todo el tiempo) - "yahg TEN-keh poo day HEH-lah TEE-dehn"
4. **Kan jag fÃ¥ en kram?** (Â¿Puedo tener un abrazo?) - "kahn yahg foh ehn krahmm?"
5. **Du Ã¤r min bÃ¤sta vÃ¤n** (Eres mi mejor amigo/a) - "doo ahr meen BES-tah vehn"
6. **Jag vill vÃ¤xa gammal med dig** (Quiero envejecer contigo) - "yahg vill VEK-sah GAH-mahl meh day"
7. **Tack fÃ¶r att du finns** (Gracias por existir) - "tahk fur aht doo feens"

## Errores Comunes Que Debes Evitar

| Error | CorrecciÃ³n | Por QuÃ© |
|--------|------------|---------|
| **Jag Ã¤lskar du** | **Jag Ã¤lskar dig** | Necesitas "dig" (objeto), no "du" (sujeto) |
| **En kÃ¤rlek** sin contexto | **Min kÃ¤rlek** | AÃ±ade posesivo para "mi amor" |
| **Du Ã¤r min vÃ¤n** (amigo) | **Du Ã¤r min vÃ¤n** / **Du Ã¤r min kompis** | "VÃ¤n" puede significar amigo o pareja, usa "kompis" para evitar confusiones |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª" title="Los Suecos y la Honestidad">
Los suecos valoran la sinceridad. Decir exactamente lo que sientes es considerado romÃ¡ntico, no cursi. Â¡SÃ© directo con tu amor!
</CultureTip>

## GuÃ­a RÃ¡pida de Referencia

### Orden BÃ¡sico de Frases
**Sujeto + Verbo + Objeto + Lugar + Tiempo**

### Preguntas
**Verbo + Sujeto + Objeto**

### NegaciÃ³n
AÃ±ade **inte** despuÃ©s del verbo:
- **Jag Ã¤lskar dig inte** (No te amo) - "yahg ELS-kahr day IN-teh"

### Preguntas SÃ­/No
**Ja** (sÃ­) / **Nej** (no) - "yah" / "nay"

## Â¿QuÃ© Sigue Ahora?

Â¡Felicidades! Ya tienen las herramientas bÃ¡sicas para construir frases romÃ¡nticas en sueco. El siguiente paso es [aprender vocabulario para citas romÃ¡nticas](/learn/es/sv/date-night-vocabulary/) y practicar [cÃ³mo decir te amo en diferentes situaciones](/learn/es/sv/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-swedish/).

Recuerden: la prÃ¡ctica diaria juntos es la clave. Empiecen cada maÃ±ana con un "God morgon, min Ã¤lskling" (Buenos dÃ­as, mi amor - "gohd MOR-gohn, meen ELS-kleeng") y verÃ¡n cÃ³mo su conexiÃ³n se fortalece mientras aprenden.

<CTA />

articles.title: Expresii pentru ÃntÃ¢lnirea cu Socrii Ã®n SpaniolÄƒ
articles.content:
Familia este extrem de importantÄƒ Ã®n cultura hispanicÄƒ. ÃntÃ¢lnirea cu pÄƒrinÈ›ii partenerului spaniol sau latino-american este un pas semnificativ Ã®n relaÈ›ie.

## ImportanÈ›a Familiei Ã®n Cultura HispanicÄƒ

Ãn culturile hispanice, familia extinsÄƒ joacÄƒ un rol central. Aprobarea pÄƒrinÈ›ilor conteazÄƒ mult, iar relaÈ›iile de familie sunt strÃ¢nse È™i calde.

## Expresii pentru Prima ÃntÃ¢lnire

### SalutÄƒri

<Phrase>
  <Original>Es un placer conocerlos por fin.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Es un plaser conoserlos por fin.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>E o plÄƒcere sÄƒ vÄƒ cunosc Ã®n sfÃ¢rÈ™it.</Translation>
  <Context>O salutare caldÄƒ la prima Ã®ntÃ¢lnire.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>[Nombre] me ha hablado mucho de ustedes.</Original>
  <Transliteration>[Nombre] me a ablado mucho de ustedes.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>[Numele] mi-a vorbit mult despre dumneavoastrÄƒ.</Translation>
  <Context>AratÄƒ cÄƒ partenerul vorbeÈ™te frumos despre ei.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Muchas gracias por recibirme en su casa.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Muchas grasias por resibirme en su casa.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>VÄƒ mulÈ›umesc mult cÄƒ m-aÈ›i primit Ã®n casa dumneavoastrÄƒ.</Translation>
  <Context>ExprimÄƒ recunoÈ™tinÈ›Äƒ pentru ospitalitate.</Context>
</Phrase>

### La MasÄƒ

<Phrase>
  <Original>Â¡QuÃ© rico estÃ¡ todo! Â¿Usted lo preparÃ³?</Original>
  <Transliteration>Che rico esta todo! Usted lo preparo?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Ce gustos e totul! DumneavoastrÄƒ l-aÈ›i pregÄƒtit?</Translation>
  <Context>ComplimenteazÄƒ mÃ¢ncarea.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Â¿Me podrÃ­a dar la receta?</Original>
  <Transliteration>Me podria dar la reseta?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Ãmi puteÈ›i da reÈ›eta?</Translation>
  <Context>AratÄƒ apreciere pentru gÄƒtit.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Â¿Puedo ayudar en algo?</Original>
  <Transliteration>Puedo aiudar en algo?</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Pot sÄƒ ajut cu ceva?</Translation>
  <Context>OferÄƒ-te sÄƒ ajuÈ›i.</Context>
</Phrase>

### ConversaÈ›ie

<Phrase>
  <Original>Me encantarÃ­a saber mÃ¡s de [nombre] cuando era niÃ±o/niÃ±a.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Me encantaria saber mas de [...] cuando era ninio/ninia.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Mi-ar plÄƒcea sÄƒ È™tiu mai multe despre [...] cÃ¢nd era copil.</Translation>
  <Context>AratÄƒ interes pentru istoricul familiei.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Tienen una casa muy bonita.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Tienen una casa mui bonita.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>AveÈ›i o casÄƒ foarte frumoasÄƒ.</Translation>
  <Context>ComplimenteazÄƒ casa.</Context>
</Phrase>

### Despre RelaÈ›ie

<Phrase>
  <Original>Su hijo/hija me hace muy feliz.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Su iho/iha me ase mui felis.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Fiul/fiica dumneavoastrÄƒ mÄƒ face foarte fericit/fericitÄƒ.</Translation>
  <Context>AsigurÄƒ-i cÄƒ partenerul e apreciat.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Quiero mucho a [nombre].</Original>
  <Transliteration>Chiero mucho a [...].</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Ãl/o iubesc foarte mult pe [...].</Translation>
  <Context>ExprimÄƒ sentimentele.</Context>
</Phrase>

### La Plecare

<Phrase>
  <Original>Gracias por una noche maravillosa.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Grasias por una noche maraviiosa.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>MulÈ›umesc pentru o searÄƒ minunatÄƒ.</Translation>
  <Context>MulÈ›umeÈ™te pentru ospitalitate.</Context>
</Phrase>

<Phrase>
  <Original>Espero verlos pronto de nuevo.</Original>
  <Transliteration>Espero verlos pronto de nuevo.</Transliteration>
  <Translation>Sper sÄƒ vÄƒ vÄƒd din nou curÃ¢nd.</Translation>
  <Context>AratÄƒ dorinÈ›a de a menÈ›ine legÄƒtura.</Context>
</Phrase>

## Sfaturi Culturale

**Salutul**: Fii pregÄƒtit pentru Ã®mbrÄƒÈ›iÈ™Äƒri È™i sÄƒruturi pe obraz.

**MÃ¢ncarea**: Refuza politicos doar dacÄƒ e absolut necesar - a nu mÃ¢nca poate fi considerat jignitor.

**Titlurile**: FoloseÈ™te "usted" (forma de politeÈ›e) pÃ¢nÄƒ cÃ¢nd eÈ™ti invitat sÄƒ foloseÈ™ti "tÃº".

## Concluzie

Ãn familia hispanicÄƒ vei fi primit cu cÄƒldurÄƒ. Fii deschis, cÄƒlduros È™i respectuos!

articles.title: GramaticÄƒ ItalianÄƒ de BazÄƒ pentru ÃncepÄƒtori: Ghid pentru RomÃ¢ni
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

VeÈ™ti excelente! Ca vorbitor de romÃ¢nÄƒ, ai cel mai mare avantaj posibil Ã®n Ã®nvÄƒÈ›area italienei. Ambele limbi sunt romanice, foarte similare È™i aproape "veriÈ™oare." Acest ghid Ã®È›i aratÄƒ fundamentele.

## Articolele: Il, La, Lo, Gli, Le

<PhraseOfDay
  word="L'amore / La vita"
  translation="Iubirea / ViaÈ›a"
  pronunciation="la-mo-re / la vi-ta"
  context="Italiana are articole similare cu romÃ¢na, dar plasate Ã®nainte de substantiv."
/>

### Articolul HotÄƒrÃ¢t

| ItalianÄƒ | Folosire | Exemplu |
|----------|----------|---------|
| Il | Masc. sg. consoanÄƒ | il libro (cartea) |
| Lo | Masc. sg. s+cons, z | lo studente, lo zio |
| L' | Masc/fem. sg. vocalÄƒ | l'amore, l'amica |
| La | Fem. sg. consoanÄƒ | la casa (casa) |
| I | Masc. pl. consoanÄƒ | i libri (cÄƒrÈ›ile) |
| Gli | Masc. pl. vocalÄƒ/s+c/z | gli amici, gli studenti |
| Le | Fem. pl. | le case (casele) |

<VocabCard
  word="L'amore Ã¨ bello"
  translation="Iubirea e frumoasÄƒ"
  pronunciation="la-mo-re e be-lo"
  example="CÃ¢nd substantivul Ã®ncepe cu vocalÄƒ, se foloseÈ™te L'."
/>

### Articolul NehotÄƒrÃ¢t

| ItalianÄƒ | RomÃ¢nÄƒ |
|----------|--------|
| Un | Un (masc.) |
| Uno | Un (Ã®nainte de s+cons, z) |
| Una | O (fem.) |
| Un' | O (fem. Ã®nainte de vocalÄƒ) |

<CultureTip title="Similar cu RomÃ¢na!" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
RomÃ¢na are "-ul" postpus (bÄƒiatul), italianÄƒ are "il" antepus (il ragazzo). Restul este aproape identic Ã®n logicÄƒ!
</CultureTip>

## Genurile: Masculin È™i Feminin

### Reguli Generale
- Cuvintele terminate Ã®n **-o** sunt masculine: il libro, il ragazzo
- Cuvintele terminate Ã®n **-a** sunt feminine: la casa, la ragazza
- Cuvintele terminate Ã®n **-e** pot fi ambele: il mare (m), la notte (f)

<VocabCard
  word="Il cuore / La vita"
  translation="Inima / ViaÈ›a"
  pronunciation="il cuo-re / la vi-ta"
  example="Cuore = masculin, vita = feminin"
/>

## Pronumele Personale

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Pronume Personale"
  meaning="Subiect È™i complement"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "mi/me", english: "eu / pe mine" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "ti/te", english: "tu / pe tine" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "lo/la/gli/le", english: "el/ea" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "ci/noi", english: "noi / pe noi" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "vi/voi", english: "voi / pe voi" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "li/le/loro", english: "ei/ele" }
  ]}
/>

<CultureTip title="Lei = DumneavoastrÄƒ" flag="ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹">
Ãn italianÄƒ, "Lei" (cu L mare) Ã®nseamnÄƒ "dumneavoastrÄƒ" - exact ca "dumneavoastrÄƒ" Ã®n romÃ¢nÄƒ! Se conjugÄƒ la persoana a 3-a singular.
</CultureTip>

## Verbele: Prezentul

Italiana are 3 conjugÄƒri: -ARE, -ERE, -IRE

### Verbe Ã®n -ARE (amare - a iubi)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Amare"
  meaning="a iubi"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "amo", english: "eu iubesc" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "ami", english: "tu iubeÈ™ti" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "ama", english: "el/ea iubeÈ™te" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "amiamo", english: "noi iubim" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "amate", english: "voi iubiÈ›i" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "amano", english: "ei iubesc" }
  ]}
/>

### Verbe Ã®n -ERE (vedere - a vedea)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Vedere"
  meaning="a vedea"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "vedo", english: "eu vÄƒd" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "vedi", english: "tu vezi" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "vede", english: "el/ea vede" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "vediamo", english: "noi vedem" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "vedete", english: "voi vedeÈ›i" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "vedono", english: "ei vÄƒd" }
  ]}
/>

### Verbe Ã®n -IRE (dormire - a dormi)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Dormire"
  meaning="a dormi"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "dormo", english: "eu dorm" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "dormi", english: "tu dormi" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "dorme", english: "el/ea doarme" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "dormiamo", english: "noi dormim" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "dormite", english: "voi dormiÈ›i" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "dormono", english: "ei dorm" }
  ]}
/>

## Verbul ESSERE (A Fi)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Essere"
  meaning="a fi"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "sono", english: "eu sunt" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "sei", english: "tu eÈ™ti" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "Ã¨", english: "el/ea este" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "siamo", english: "noi suntem" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "siete", english: "voi sunteÈ›i" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "sono", english: "ei sunt" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sono innamorato/a di te"
  translation="Sunt Ã®ndrÄƒgostit/Äƒ de tine"
  pronunciation="so-no in-na-mo-ra-to/a di te"
  example="Sono innamorato di te dal primo giorno."
/>

## Verbul AVERE (A Avea)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Avere"
  meaning="a avea"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Io", polish: "ho", english: "eu am" },
    { person: "Tu", polish: "hai", english: "tu ai" },
    { person: "Lui/Lei", polish: "ha", english: "el/ea are" },
    { person: "Noi", polish: "abbiamo", english: "noi avem" },
    { person: "Voi", polish: "avete", english: "voi aveÈ›i" },
    { person: "Loro", polish: "hanno", english: "ei au" }
  ]}
/>

## NegaÈ›ia

Ãn italianÄƒ, negaÈ›ia este simplÄƒ - adaugi "non" Ã®nainte de verb:

<VocabCard
  word="Non ti amo"
  translation="Nu te iubesc"
  pronunciation="non ti a-mo"
  example="Non Ã¨ vero! Ti amo tantissimo!"
/>

- Ti amo â†’ Non ti amo
- Sono felice â†’ Non sono felice
- Ho tempo â†’ Non ho tempo

## ÃntrebÄƒrile

Ãn italianÄƒ, Ã®ntrebÄƒrile se formeazÄƒ simplu prin intonaÈ›ie:

<VocabCard
  word="Mi ami?"
  translation="MÄƒ iubeÈ™ti?"
  pronunciation="mi a-mi"
  example="Mi ami? - SÃ¬, ti amo tantissimo!"
/>

**Cuvinte interogative:**
| ItalianÄƒ | RomÃ¢nÄƒ |
|----------|--------|
| Che/Cosa | Ce? |
| Chi | Cine? |
| Dove | Unde? |
| Quando | CÃ¢nd? |
| PerchÃ© | De ce? |
| Come | Cum? |
| Quanto/a | CÃ¢t/CÃ¢tÄƒ? |

## Adjectivele

Adjectivele se acordÄƒ Ã®n gen È™i numÄƒr È™i de obicei vin DUPÄ‚ substantiv:

<VocabCard
  word="Una donna bella / Un uomo bello"
  translation="O femeie frumoasÄƒ / Un bÄƒrbat frumos"
  pronunciation="u-na do-na be-la / un uo-mo be-lo"
  example="Adjectivele Ã®n -o/-a se schimbÄƒ dupÄƒ gen."
/>

| Masculin sg. | Feminin sg. | Masculin pl. | Feminin pl. |
|--------------|-------------|--------------|-------------|
| bello | bella | belli | belle |
| alto | alta | alti | alte |
| grande | grande | grandi | grandi |

## Posesivele

| RomÃ¢nÄƒ | Masc. sg. | Fem. sg. | Masc. pl. | Fem. pl. |
|--------|-----------|----------|-----------|----------|
| al meu | il mio | la mia | i miei | le mie |
| al tÄƒu | il tuo | la tua | i tuoi | le tue |
| al lui/ei | il suo | la sua | i suoi | le sue |
| al nostru | il nostro | la nostra | i nostri | le nostre |
| al vostru | il vostro | la vostra | i vostri | le vostre |
| al lor | il loro | la loro | i loro | le loro |

<VocabCard
  word="Il mio amore / La mia vita"
  translation="Iubirea mea / ViaÈ›a mea"
  pronunciation="il mio a-mo-re / la mia vi-ta"
  example="Posesivul se acordÄƒ cu obiectul posedat, ca Ã®n romÃ¢nÄƒ!"
/>


## Similitudini RomÃ¢na - Italiana

| Aspect | RomÃ¢nÄƒ | ItalianÄƒ |
|--------|--------|----------|
| Genuri | 3 (m, f, n) | 2 (m, f) |
| ConjugÄƒri | 4 | 3 |
| Ordine SVO | Da | Da |
| Articole | Postpuse | Antepuse |
| Acordul adj. | Da | Da |

## Cuvinte Aproape Identice

| RomÃ¢nÄƒ | ItalianÄƒ |
|--------|----------|
| amor | amore |
| viaÈ›Äƒ | vita |
| noapte | notte |
| inimÄƒ | cuore |
| frumos | bello |

<CTA
  text="PregÄƒtit sÄƒ exersezi gramaticÄƒ italianÄƒ?"
  buttonText="Ãncepe sÄƒ ÃnveÈ›i ÃmpreunÄƒ"
/>
